meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new climate or environment again.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a different country, she reacclimatized to the new weather quickly.
meanings.sent2: The polar bear reacclimatized to the cold temperatures after spending time in a warmer climate.
meanings.sent3: The penguin reacclimatized to the tropical island, but missed the icy waters of Antarctica.
meanings.sent4: Like a plant reacclimatizing to sunlight after being in the shade, she slowly adjusted to the bright environment.
meanings.sent5: His body reacclimatized to the high altitude, allowing him to climb the mountain with ease.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a familiar climate or environment after a period of absence.
meanings.sent1: Having been away for months, he reacclimatized to the familiar routines of his hometown.
meanings.sent2: The migratory birds reacclimatized to their nesting grounds after a long winter in the south.
meanings.sent3: The cat reacclimatized to the cozy house, claiming its favorite spot by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: Just like a sailor reacclimatizing to the rocking motion of the boat, she found her sea legs again.
meanings.sent5: Her taste buds reacclimatized to the spicy food, reminding her of the flavors from her childhood.
